info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 13 at 3:50AM CST until January 16 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON CST TUESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT: Very cold wind chills are expected...with wind chills ranging from zero to as low as 15 below zero. Heavy snow also possible...with widespread total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches possible. Locally higher amounts possible. * WHERE: For the Wind Chill Advisory...much of western... northwestern...and northern Arkansas. For the Winter Storm Watch...most of Arkansas. * WHEN: For the Wind Chill Advisory...from 6 PM this evening to noon CST Tuesday. For the Winter Storm Watch...from Sunday afternoon through Monday afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS: With Arctic air firmly in place before and after the winter weather arrives...impacts from snowfall will last for several days...resulting in a prolonged period of hazardous travel conditions. Bitter cold wind chills could result in frostbite as well as significant impacts to infrastructure.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
